intro: Hieracium bectauatense, commonly known as the Bectauatense hawkweed, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions in Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and is known for its yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium bectauatense is a perennial herb with a robust root system and hairy stems. Its botanical features make it an important subject in ecological and taxonomic studies.
